meanings.definition: In a manner involving multiple factors
meanings.sent1: She analyzed the situation multifactorially to understand all the different influences at play.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the experiment multifactorially to determine the various causes of the results.
meanings.sent3: The detective looked at the case multifactorially, considering every possible clue.
meanings.sent4: Her approach to problem-solving was like a multifactorial equation, taking into account all the variables.
meanings.sent5: By examining the issue multifactorially, she was able to uncover the hidden complexities.

meanings.definition: In a way that considers various contributing elements
meanings.sent1: He approached the project multifactorially, taking into account all the different aspects.
meanings.sent2: The team analyzed the data multifactorially to identify the key factors influencing the outcome.
meanings.sent3: The chef created a dish multifactorially, blending diverse flavors for a unique taste.
meanings.sent4: Her decision-making process was multifactorial, weighing all the contributing factors.
meanings.sent5: By approaching the problem multifactorially, they were able to find a comprehensive solution.
